pageContext.claim: “I say it all the time, I said it when I left Michigan. 2016, the night of the election, we have 32,000 people, Hillary was there just before me in a prime location, she'd about 400 people and we had 30. I got there 12 in the evening, I started speaking at 1:00 in the morning. It's now election day and I left, 32,000 people.”
pageContext.analysis: This is a fantasy. The Michigan venue where Trump rallied in the early morning hours of Election Day 2016, DeVos Place in downtown Grand Rapids, has a capacity of 4,200, far less than the 32,000 claimed by Trump. (Perhaps that many were waiting outside, for a total of 8,000, local media estimated.) Hillary Clinton held a rally the same day at nearby Grand Valley State University; it was described as a “capacity crowd” at a venue that holds 4,100 people.
